content.prompt: Which of the following conclusions about dietary iron and ferritin synthesis is best supported by the data in Figure 1?

choices.label: A dietary iron concentration of 25 mg/kg has no effect on ferritin gene expression compared with the control diet.
At a dietary iron concentration of 50 mg/kg, rats make twice as much ferritin as rats fed the control diet do.
Maximum activation of ferritin synthesis occurs at dietary iron concentrations of 75 mg/kg or greater.
The maximum rate of ferritin absorption from the gut occurs at dietary iron concentrations greater than 75 mg/kg.

skill.text: 6.C: Provide reasoning to justify a claim by connecting evidence to biological theories.
